newsitem.title: UK: Blenheim says takeover talks have ended.
newsitem.headline: Blenheim says takeover talks have ended.

text.p: Exhibitions organiser Blenheim Group Plc said on Friday that discussions with an unnamed party about a possible takeover of the group had been terminated.
"Blenheim has not received proposals which its Board believes should be recommended to shareholders," the company said in a statement.
On August 1 Blenheim confirmed that it was in talks that could lead to an offer for the company.
At that time, Anglo-Dutch media publisher Reed-Elsevier had been cited in press reports as a potential bidder but Reed has declined to comment that it was holding takeover talks with Blenheim.
Blenheim, which reports first-half results on October 2, also said that its performance during the first six months of the year had been "very strong".
